page.title: 17Churches in Kingswood.
page.content: There are 21{churches}in the Kingswood area. 6 of these churches are of the{Methodist Faith.}The reasons for the large number of Methodist Churches are historical. The area was once a{coalfield.}In{1673}73 small pits were being worked in the Kingswoood coalfield but by 1723 the number had doubled. The Kingswood coalfield acquired a notorious reputation. It attracted the rougher elements of society and the area was neglected by the clergy of the{Church {of England. {George Whitfield,}an Anglican minister, and, later on,{John Wesley, changed this situation. The two men preached, often from horseback,to crowds of colliers 200 t0 300 strong. They led a{religious revival}which resulted in the large number of {Methodist Churches}in Kingswood.
